title: Ezreal got dumpstered this patch...

embed.description: LoL Statistics, Builds, Runes, Masteries, Skill Orders, Counters and Matchups for Ezreal when played ADC. Statistics include Ezreal's Win Rate, Play Rate and Ban Rate. Counters include who Ezreal ADC is Strong or Weak Against.

body:
I don't know who at Riot thought that the Trinity + Essence Reaver changes would actually do anything to help Ezreal's current state but they were wrong. I've played Ezreal several times this patch and each game it feels like he is seriously lacking.

{{item:3078}} 

Where to begin? Trinity Force now costs more, gives 5 less AD, 30 less AP, 15% less Attack Speed. The base AD changes on ADCs also hurts Ezreal as you are now losing 20 damage per Trinity Proc. 0.4 AP ratio on Q means you lose an additional 12 damage, and the 30 AP loss affects his other three spells quite noticeably. You want Ezreals to itemize for 40% CDR, but it doesn't matter because he lost a significant chunk of damage on all his abilities.  We are talking like 50 damage per Mystic Shot here which is at least 10% damage lost, and 20 damage off W, E, R. Let's move on though shall we?

{{item:3508}} 

Oh boy. This is a noob trap on Ezreal if I ever saw it. Pre 5.22, Essence Reaver was an actually decent Bloodthirster alternative for Ezreal. 10% CDR, 80 AD, lifesteal, and if you landed a Q the mana cost was essentially refunded. Now Essence Reaver has the cost increased dramatically, and lost 15 AD and the lifesteal, in exchange for 20% crit and CDR. This does not benefit Ezreal in the least because you could reach 30% CDR easily with masteries, ER, and Lucidity boots. You free up his Boot choice so I can run Zerkers now but that is a moot point since Trinity lost so much attack speed. The missing Lifesteal hurts Ezreal significantly as well as the fact he only restores mana on crits. I used to have zero mana issues before when purchasing this item, now I'm running dry all the time unless I have an opportunity to auto some minion waves between fights. Essence Reaver was supposed to be good on Ezreal but basically it just pushed Graves and Lucian way over the top while doing nothing for Ezreal.

That is not all though. While other ADCs received buffs, Ezreal has longer cooldowns on Q and E, essentially forcing him to go this absolute GARBAGE Essence Reaver + Trinity build so his spells are up as often as they were before the patch. His W is still practically non-existent and at rank 1 usually costs more mana than it does damage. Why did Riot think making Ezreal's core build more expensive in exchange for some CDR would make him powerful when he has useless, poorly scaling abilities?

I'm really upset with this patch and it might be enough to turn me off this game completely. This is just one of many things that have pissed me right off about 5.22 but Ezreal was always my favorite ADC and hes even weaker than before now.

replies.body: I'm honestly surprised at how many people think you're not supposed to autoattack on Ezreal. This is beyond ridiculous. He's a caster yes, but he's still a damn adc

No one said anything about Ezreal not autoattacking

The thing is with -20 AD and -15% attack speed on your core, the auto attacks come out slow and deal like 10% less damage. Yes, some of them crit, but it's not like they are IE crits until later in the game (and if you rush Trinity IE, where is this AWESOME 40% CDR coming from?) and you don't have Lifesteal until later in the game either.

5.21 Ezreal's auto attacks were more potent on non-crits than they are now with the same items, and his Q W E R all hit at least 10% harder. The 5.22 changes are a sidegrade AT BEST, where if you can safely get several auto attacks off your DPS is the same as before, but at what cost? Weaker spells and more expensive items. 5.22 Ezreal is an all-in on a perfect scenario where the team ignores you while you get several crits off. 5.21 Ezreal could actually function in the real world where 5 people are chasing you down trying to kill you and you have to Q, auto, and E while on the run.
They should make his Q crit.

Are you crazy? Do you know how strong he would be if his Q crit?  What he needs is something done to his W, it's a worthless ability that helps with his passive very slightly.  When he was in line for buffs, instead of helping it out, they added an AD ratio to his E for some reason.  W needs to do something - giving Q the ability to crit would be outrageous.

> [{quoted}](name=Keevalroy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JvN1tfim,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-11-16T02:14:17.738+0000)

When he was in line for buffs, instead of helping it out, they added an AD ratio to his E for some reason.  W needs to do something - giving Q the ability to crit would be outrageous.

they should make it crit, but balance it then, because right now he has far less damage then any ADC

then of course, they shoum make his W usefull to AD ez, but riot didn't buff it since 2012 and buffed the other spells so i doubt they will do it

Basically the only two trinity user I have figured out who actually likes the higher crit and CDR in place of the attack speed and AP is Gankplank and Yasuo.

Irelia does not like the changes.
Jax while he is not killed by the changes is not benefiting from them
Kog made full use of the AP and attack speed but not so much the CDR currently on it.
Nasus is not really getting anything for the change that hurts or helps but will likely be getting IBG mroe often
While vayne likely benefits from it there is still less attack speed which in turn likely leaver her fairly neutral with the changes on trinity.


It seems like they were trying to make trinity an item that ezreal players would be ecstatic about but in the end failed to even make it ideal for Ezreal.

I know how they could fix it without making it like they had it last season but the chances of them actually being up for calling and making trinity an on-hit item is slim to none.

For the time being though Irelia and Jax are making use of rageblade since it is more damage for 65.7% of the cost.

If you need math for the theoretical damage output of last seaso ntrinity, current trinity or rageblade as well asa suggestion make trinity on hit that would actually be worth getting on champs who don't give a shit about crit chance and jsut want on hit I made a post about that already.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/w5K7cA18-riot-did-you-even-really-try-making-trinity-into-an-on-hit-item-instead-of-a-marksmen-item

Agreed I had my friend go Trinity on Irelia last night and he got absolutely wrecked. Way more expensive and less attack speed. I have seen Gangplanks with it and they seem to do much better.

Very frustrating I used to love Trinity on Ezreal and now it costs so much and gives him too little. Without it though your Qs tickle and you run so slow. Ezreal just feels really sluggish and weak this patch and I don't like it one bit.
what about {{champion:236}}

Speaking of Yasuo, you are better off going for just {{item:3087}} and {{item:3031}} 

Thanks to the buffs on Statikk Shiv, you can reach 100% critical strike chance with just it and Infinity Edge. You no longer need to use Trinity Force anymore. Before this patch, the only real reason why people used Trinity Force on Yasuo was to allow him to get 100% critical strike chance, as you could no longer reach it with just Statikk and Infinity Edge + crit runes, due to the nerf on Infinity Edge. While it is true that Yasuo could benefit from the Phage passive, easily proc Spellblade, and this item was overall good for him, the only real reason to use it was due to the 10% critical strike chance.

But now with the Statikk Shiv changes, you don't need to use Trinity Force. Infinity Edge is way better, as it doesn't have any wasted stats, has higher AD, and its passive is necessary to compensate for Yasuo's reduced damage on crits. Yasuo doesn't make good use of Trinity Force now that it offers less attack speed and AD. The mana is wasted, the cooldown reduction is of very little use for him, and Yasuo has a poor base attack damage, so he can't deal that much damage with the Spellblade proc.

This is good for Yasuo because before you needed not only to waste a lot of gold on those stats, but also you couldn't get other stats for a while: armor penetration, lifesteal, etc. Now you can get all those stats.

Well in that case the only champion who really benefited form trinity changes was GP.

{{champion:42}} would be enjoying it if they even went through with their word and made his passive effect the Trinity/Sheen procs. >> Statikk is off doing something else I guess and ignoring everything. Tells us his passive will actually do something to the spellblade, then never goes through with it. Makes me sad. QQ
What did you expect from some kid who dropped out of school cause he found a *magic* bracelet in a trash can and now thinks he some super hero?

thanks for the replies people

I just wanted to add that the only games I have had success with Ezreal so far is with a Rageblade / Gunblade build. Rageblade is so over-tuned it's not even funny, this 2500 gold item alone gives you absolutely everything you need damage wise and the attack speed you are lacking as well. I know Riot is going to nerf Rageblade because it is so grossly OP right now but when they do Ezreal will be garbage again.

> [{quoted}](name=dangopee,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JvN1tfim,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-11-16T01:20:38.213+0000)
>
> They should make his Q crit.


He really needs the AD portion of his Q to scale with crit, like {{champion:22}} passive. 1.0 AD Ratio, with an additional 10% AD damage per every 10% crit chance he has. The base damage and Trinity proc critting would likely be over the top but having a 1.4 AD ratio with Essence and Trinity finished would offset the huge nerfs to the AD and AP of his item core. 

He also needs his W to be either reworked, or have some of it's damage / functionality restored. This ability is absolute garbage and some people don't even rank it until level 14. There was no reason for Riot to nerf the hitbox and base damage of the ability before COMPLETELY removing the attack speed debuff portion. They could have easily made the attack speed debuff half as effective as the buff (10% scaling up to 20%) and left the base damage and hitbox alone, but instead they attacked the spell's damage before addressing the debuff. I can't think of a single spell in League of Legends less satisfying to cast than AD Ezreal's W.

> [{quoted}](name=RickSanchez C137,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JvN1tfim,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-11-16T01:40:37.528+0000)
>
 I can't think of a single spell in League of Legends less satisfying to cast than AD Ezreal's W.

And yet i don't see that many good anivias take it tell level 13 they all ways go Q-E-Q-E-Q-R--E-Q-E-Q-E-R-W-W-W-R-W-W "i think thats how the skills are. I'm bad at coming up with it and not just click on the ability or know when i can or can not take it."

> [{quoted}](name=Hencho101,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JvN1tfim,comment-id=0003000000000001,timestamp=2015-11-16T16:56:19.895+0000)
>

The most efficient damage you can do is maxing Q, assuming you can get off the double damage from the explosion. It's also your cheapest waveclear. So against immobile waveclearing mages, especially if they suck at dodging, you max Q.

However, against some champs (like yasuo), you can't easily land your Q at all, much less your Q2. Therefore, you max E instead so you can repeatedly E-R them post-6.

You almost never max W, because you want damage. That'd be like Viktor maxing Gravity Field, or Ziggs maxing Satchel Charge. However, if you're against a lane opponent with a gap-closer and kill pressure (irelia) or if you're getting camped by the enemy jg, you want a point, maybe two, in wall ASAP.


Like Gravity Field, Anivia's wall is still a massively impactful ability, late-game. I once won a 45-min game by knocking an out-of-position Tristiana out of her jump, allowing my team to collapse on her. Obviously that's just one game out of millions, but it's an example of how a wall can be impactful.

The base damage and Trinity proc critting would likely be over the top but having a 1.4 AD ratio with Essence and Trinity finished would offset the huge nerfs to the AD and AP of his item core.

There was no reason for Riot to nerf the hitbox and base damage of the ability before COMPLETELY removing the attack speed debuff portion. They could have easily made the attack speed debuff half as effective as the buff (10% scaling up to 20%) and left the base damage and hitbox alone, but instead they attacked the spell's damage before addressing the debuff. I can't think of a single spell in League of Legends less satisfying to cast than AD Ezreal's W.

they need to just give ezreal his heal back on W and take his atk spd buff/debuff away. i miss ezreals original W

I literally started playing him the patch they removed the heal completely (I believe it was at 25% effectiveness before they just canned it). I was choked. I was even more upset after the Season 2 finals when they removed the attack speed debuff, the spell is completely un-fun now.

I've always thought Ezreal's W was an interesting spell, it looks and sounds cool, but it doesn't do anything on cast. I really wish Riot would stop ignoring how bad Ezreal is now and give his W something, anything, I don't care what but make it worth the mana to cast it. They made Lucian's W do something interesting / useful for him, I don't know why Ezreal never gets any love.

> [{quoted}](name=RickSanchez C137,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JvN1tfim,comment-id=000300020000,timestamp=2015-11-17T01:43:05.904+0000)

I really wish Riot would stop ignoring how bad Ezreal is now and give his W something, anything, I don't care what but make it worth the mana to cast it. They made Lucian's W do something interesting / useful for him, I don't know why Ezreal never gets any love.

would be interesting if it placed a debuff that made ezreals nxt dmg AA count as a mystic shot

I feel like he's overall much better let me explain why.

Q - Mystic Shot
COOLDOWN 6/5.5/5/4.5/4 seconds ⇒ 6.5/6/5.5/5/4.5 seconds
COOLDOWN REDUCTION ON-HIT 1 second ⇒ 1.5 seconds

E - Arcane Shift
COOLDOWN 19/17/15/13/11 seconds ⇒ 19/17.5/16/14.5/13 seconds

His Q has the same CD as before if he lands a skill shot but his W/Ult really benefit from the 0.5 second CDR on hit buff since their CDs weren't changed. So basically the more accurate an Ezreal the more profitable these changes will be.

{{item:3078}} {{item:3508}} 
90 Damage. 40% Crit, 40% CDR and other stats.

Masteries
Sorcery really helps his poke with the 2% increased damage.

Fervor of battle applies to his Qs so he can choose that or he can take the heal crit path.

With games being considerably shorter it really benefits him to be able to Ult more often, have max CDR after only 2 items and also not have to rush Manamune anymore due to essence reavers mana gain being so efficient. Yes crits only but with 40% crits and autos betweens Q's I find it pretty easy to keep my mana up. The previous Reaver was really poor for sustaining your mana overall. Also the attack speed didn't hurt him because Ezreal is a caster not an auto attacking based ADC, overall he is a really strong pick mid or top and a very good ADC against ranged poke.

Be aware that Sorcery shouldn't increase his Q damage, since it's coded as a skillshot basic attack, effectively. Deathfire Touch isn't applied on it, and neither are any spell-based effects, so I doubt Sorcery increases its damage.

Your math on Trinity + Essence Reaver's AD is way off. I have no idea where you got 130 damage from. It gives 25 + 65, or 90 AD this patch. Before in 5.21 it gave 30 + 80 for 110. Not only that but the items cost 600 gold more than before. Pretty harsh nerf.

You have no more Lifesteal on these core two items. You have 15% less attack speed and no AP. You gain CDR and crit but at an extremely severe cost. As you said yourself, Ezreal's auto attack DPS isn't very great so the 40% crit doesn't help as much, and with the loss of attack speed and AD, his overall auto attack DPS is much worse than before on non-crits. They gutted everything about him in exchange for crit and CDR, but I was able to reach 30% CDR with TF, ER and Lucidity before, so the CDR is moot, and they ruined Ezreal's AD and Attack Speed so the crits don't make up for the auto attacks being weaker.
League logic dictates change will happen if we all pitch in and whine more like this guy.
sadly {{champion:81}} wasn't the only adc to get dumpstered this patch {{champion:29}} {{champion:110}}

Some PBE changes to other ADCs, but still no word about Ezreal unfortunately. A step in the right direction nerfing the OP outliers but I still don't think Ezreal will be a reliable choice next patch without item changes or direct changes.

*Sees title*
Yeah him and many others.
I wonder what double lift will have to say?

Not as hard as Zed.

nerfed in almost every single aspect.

Yeah same with all the BOTRK core champs, vaynes winrate went down to 50.2%, zed is at some 46% or something now I think.... I've tried the ravenous hydra build but it doesn't really give you as much sticking power, and the new crit heal mastery gives ADC's enough lifesteal to survive your burst a lot of the times. What a crazy patch

Vayne actually received REAL nerfs though with losing about 24ish AD by level 18, plus her W doesn't do the flat damage so it loses out on damage until late game, and as we know BotRK got nerfed on TOP of the AS/Crit items losing attack speed.

> [{quoted}](name=Zair Umbras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JvN1tfim,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-11-16T07:40:22.436+0000)
>
> Vayne actually received REAL nerfs though with **_losing about 24ish AD by level 18_**, plus her W doesn't do the flat damage so it loses out on damage until late game, and as we know BotRK got nerfed on TOP of the AS/Crit items losing attack speed.

I knew she felt weaker...And not just because of the passive and BORK changes either.

Vayne
BASE ATTACK DAMAGE 50.46 ⇒ 56.88
ATTACK DAMAGE GROWTH STAT 3.25 ⇒ 1.66

That's the info from the patch notes. Normally, she'd start at 50.46 and gain 55.25 AD, totaling 105.71 AD. Now she starts at 56.88 and gains 28.22, totaling 85.1. That's about 20 AD, not 24. But yeah... she lost a good chunk of base AD, as did many ADC's, but her and MF lost the most, MF losing 3 base AD and 2 per level, totaling a loss of 37 AD, but she does 60%-100% of her AD on the first hit, pretty much guaranteeing ungodly damage. 

So yeah... People overlooked those sorta changes when shouting out 'OUR ADC OVERLORDS'.

> [{quoted}](name=SwapShadows,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JvN1tfim,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-11-16T01:18:21.361+0000)
>
> Not as hard as Zed.
> 
> nerfed in almost every single aspect.

This patch has been a clusterfuck of proxy buffs and nerfs through the item, mastery, and gameplay tuning changes. I understand experimenting to improve, but in order to make sense of shit, you need to limit the independent variables. This patch has so many independent variables...fuck.

-{{champion:121}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:35}} and {{champion:421}} dirtboxed by the AD changes
-{{champion:115}} {{champion:90}}  {{champion:48}} {{champion:18}} and  {{champion:222}}  now melt towers even faster now as if they're wielding flamethrowers against paper mache mailboxes soaked in kerosene that shoot stamps at you instead of doing damage
-Not even going into the {{champion:157}} and  {{champion:23}} shenanigans
-{{champion:22}} {{champion:81}} {{champion:110}}  and pretty much any poke/control marksman have identity crises
-People are losing their shit over the mana changes and having to relearn {{champion:34}} {{champion:134}} {{champion:78}} and literally every mana-hungry caster/brawler ever.
-Like jungling? Guess what, it's back to bronze with you, gotta relearn that shit. Again. In 5 games today I've had 3 people that have been gold ranked junglers in the past DIE TO CAMPS. TO CAMPS. NO INVADES.
-{{champion:40}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:37}} Now with 25% more tiltability by way of the windshriekers blessing. Fun.
-The fucking weirdness of how this patch has somehow helped {{champion:7}} {{champion:38}} and {{champion:131}} is strangely terrifying and simultaneously revolting.

I could go on for days with a list of how Riot took game balance and systematically pummeled it with an electrified sledgehammer until it shit its pants and started wearing them as a hat out of pain delirium, but it's probably easiest to say that for now balance is fucked. Just straight fucked with no lube.

No idea why they'd want to do something like this, but then again I don't wanna know, either.

> [{quoted}](name=BansheeSorceress,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JvN1tfim,comment-id=000100020000,timestamp=2015-11-16T06:10:28.980+0000)

> You will know fear {{champion:16}}

Fear The Banana.

They increased his ability to kite via early access to CDR.. which means what?

 {{item:3158}} {{item:3043}}  {{item:3025}}{{item:3153}} {{item:3036}} /{{item:3033}} {{item:3812}}

Triforce is pretty garbage on him now. Why buy it?

Death's Dance isn't even good on him. o.o He only does physical with his Q, which applies on-hits. That 10% CDR ain't worth losing out on the LS and bubble from a BT.

I mean it's not bad on him.

His autos also deal physical damage >.< And his Q and autos are his primary damage sources with this build, aka ~70% or more... so "only" 2/3+ of his damage works with the healing effect.

Main reason you'd get it, though, is to delay incoming damage, allowing you to kite/lifesteal more effectively. Everything it gives you suites this purpose nicely, from the CDR to the AD. But if you prefer, bloodthirster and ghostblade both work fine. BT accentuates the poke/LS, GB gives more CDR, flat pen for squishies, and attack speed to better abuse botrk. Not to mention plenty of AD on both.
